common_cold.medical_definition: Viral infection of the upper respiratory tract, most commonly caused by rhinoviruses
common_cold.layman_explanation: A common cold is like your body's way of fighting off a tiny virus that got into your nose or throat. It's your immune system working hard to get rid of the invader, which causes all those annoying symptoms like a runny nose and cough.
when_to_see_doctor: Fever above 101°F for more than 3 days

influenza.medical_definition: Acute viral infection of the respiratory tract caused by influenza viruses
influenza.layman_explanation: The flu is like a really bad cold that comes on suddenly and makes you feel much worse. It's caused by a different virus that's more powerful than the common cold virus, which is why you feel so terrible.
when_to_see_doctor: Difficulty breathing or shortness of breath
High fever that doesn't respond to medication

pneumonia.medical_definition: Inflammation of the lungs caused by infection, resulting in fluid or pus filling the air sacs
pneumonia.layman_explanation: Pneumonia is when your lungs get infected and filled with fluid, making it hard to breathe. It's like your lungs are trying to fight off an infection, but they get so full of fluid that breathing becomes difficult.

bronchitis.medical_definition: Inflammation of the bronchial tubes that carry air to and from the lungs
bronchitis.layman_explanation: Bronchitis is when the tubes that carry air to your lungs get irritated and swollen. It's like having a sore throat, but in your chest, which makes you cough a lot to try to clear out the irritation.

asthma.medical_definition: Chronic inflammatory disease of the airways characterized by reversible airflow obstruction and bronchospasm
asthma.layman_explanation: Asthma is when your breathing tubes get swollen and tight, making it hard to breathe. It's like trying to breathe through a straw that keeps getting smaller. This can happen when you're around things that irritate your lungs.
when_to_see_doctor: Symptoms that interfere with daily activities
Emergency inhaler use more than twice a week
Symptoms that wake you up at night
